title: Bonnington Released-1920s Style for Today
content:
Bonnington is a Roman display face full of the spirit of the 1920s, developing further the ideas in our Bonning family.

Three weights are offered, including a shadowed black form, in a choice of regular and condensed widths. More…

It’s the ideal face for signage with a period feel, as well as posters and headings. Combine Bonnington and Bonning together using Bonnington for eye-catching headings and Bonning for other text. Careful slection of the Glyphs can give a delightfully formal yet hand lettered feel.

You can see Bonnington in action on our [blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014124930/http:/gatf.wordpress.com/) or try it for yourself on [Myfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014124930/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/bonnington/).

Meanwhile, Here's one example of Bonnington in action (lots more on the [blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014124930/http:/gatf.wordpress.com/)):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014124930im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Bonnington_Gallery6_5263.png)
author: Rasendyll
